answers.answer: MedHelp.com is very specific that we do not make a diagnosis or treat individuals. With restatement of those principles the most common thing would be undiagnosed and/or out of control diabetes mellitus.  Spasm of accommodation could cause those symptoms but its very very rare. Less common in 18 year olds: strokes, subdural hematomas, intercranial hemorrhage, myasthenia gravis, 6th cranial nerve paralysis/paresis.JCH MD
the case doesnot have diabetes mellitus nor induced spasm of accomodation
That leaves quite a few other causes. She needs referral to an ophthalmologist as soon as possible.JCH MD

question: A 18 year female student presented in our clinic one week before her final examination complaining of intermitttent double vision and poor distant vision.she had already get checked up 1 month before and was found emmetropic? what do u think be the appropraite condition she is suffering with?
title: Whats the Daignosis?
